revised_title: Sir Dugald Clerk: A Pioneering Engineer and Educator
tldr: Sir Dugald Clerk was a renowned engineer and educator who played a significant role in the development of the internal combustion engine. He combined scientific theory with practical experience and inspired many through his teaching and research. Clerk's contributions to engineering, such as the Clerk or two-cycle engine, and his work on specific heat of gases and gaseous explosions, earned him recognition and honors from the Royal Society and other institutions. He also contributed to various educational institutions and played a crucial role in engineering research during World War I.
